class Function.Dependent(arguments)[source]

Bases: object

__Purpose__

Store properties for a function that requires input from another function

__Attributes__
arguments [dict of list of sympy.Symbol]: arguments to be substituted into from another function

keys [str] are species of argument (e.g. “variables”, “parameters”, “functions”) values [sympy.Symbol] are symbolic general arguments

getArgumentSubstitutions(parent, specie)[source]
__Purpose__

Get substitutions for dependent, i.e. which instance argument to substitute into each general argument

__Inputs__

parent [Parent]: parent function to retrieve instance arguments from specie [str]: species of argument to retrieve

Return type

Dict[str, Expr]

getGeneralArguments(species=None, nested=False)[source]
__Purpose__

Get general arguments of Dependent Function object

__Inputs__

species [str, list of str]: species of argument to get nested [bool]:

True: includes general arguments of children functions False: includes general arguments explicitly of self function

__Return__
dict of list of sympy.Symbol: species [None, list of str]

key is argument species value is list of sympy.Symbol general arguments

list of sympy.Symbol: species [str]

__Recursion Base__

return arguments of single species: species [str] and nested [False]

Return type

Union[List[Symbol], Dict[str, List[Symbol]]]

getGeneralSpecies(nested=True)[source]
__Purpose__

Get species of general arguments that the dependent functions requires

__Inputs__

nested [bool]: set True to include species from children (implicit); set False to only include self species (explicit)

Return type

List[str]

__Inputs__

parent [Parent]: parent function to retrieve instance arguments from

Return type

Expr

getInstanceArgumentSubstitutions(parent, specie)[source]
__Purpose__

Get which instance arguments to substitute into general arguments

__Inputs__

parent [Parent]: parent function to retrieve instance arguments from specie [str]: species of argument to retrieve

Return type

List[Expr]

setGeneralArguments(arguments, species=None)[source]
__Purpose__

Set receiver_arguments attribute as list or dict

__Inputs__
arguments [sympy.Symbol, list of sympy.Symbol, dict of list of sympy.Symbol]: contains information on how to set attribute
sympy.Symbol, list of sympy.Symbol:

sets species [str] as key for attribute, single symbol in arguments as value species must be given

dict of list of sympy.Symbol:

key [str] is species type for argument values [sympy.Symbol, list of sympy.Symbol] are arguments associated with species

species [str]: species to associated with given arguments

__Recursion Base__

Set attribute for single species: arguments [sympy.Symbol, list of sympy.Symbol] and species [str]

Return type

None

class Function.Derivative(variable, time_evolution_type='Temporal', initial_condition=0)[source]

Bases: object

__Purpose__

Properties relating to function being a time derivative

__Attributes__

variable [sympy.Symbol]: variable that derivative is derivative of time_evolution_type [str]: time-evolution type of derivative (e.g. “Temporal”, “Equilibrium”, “Constant”) initial_condition [float]: initial condition value for associated variable

getInitialCondition()[source]

Get initial numerical condition for variable associated with derivative.

Parameters

self¶ – Derivative to retrieve initial condition from

Return type

Union[str, float]

Returns

Initial value float if value is provided. “Equilibrium” if variable begins in equilibrium with respect to other variables.

Function.FunctionMaster(name, function, inheritance=(), **kwargs)[source]
__Purpose__

Get Function object with desired properties

__Inputs__

name [str]: name associated with function function [sympy.Expr, list of Function]:

sympy.Expr: form of function (e.g. x**2 in f(x)=x**2) for non-piecewise function list of Function: collection of function pieces for piecewise function

inheritance [tuple of classes]: classes for function to inherit

Dependent: inherit if function requires input (e.g. variable or parameter input) Derivative: inherit if function should be included in ODE of model Piecewise: inherit if function is piecewise NonPiecewise: inherit if function is non-piecewise

**kwargs [dict]: arguments to be given to each inherited class’s __init__

e.g. kwargs[“Dependent”] holds arguments for Dependent __init__ if function inherits Dependent class

Return type

Function

Bases: object

__Purpose__

class Function.Model(functions=None, parameters=None)[source]

Bases: object

__Purpose__

Store Function objects for given model

__Attributes__

functions [list of Function]: stored Function objects parameters [dict of metpy.Quantity]: stored parameter values and units

key [str] is parameter name value [metpy.Quantity] contains value and unit

addFunctions(functions, overwrite=True)[source]

Add Function object(s) to model. Set self as model for Function object(s).

Parameters

  • self¶ – ~Function.Model to add function to

  • functions¶ – function(s) to add to model

  • overwrite¶ – set True to overwrite function if already in model. Set False to raise error for duplicate function name.

Return type

None

addParameters(quantities)[source]

Set/add parameter(s) value and unit for model as Quantity.

Parameters

  • self¶ – ~Function.Model to set parameter(s) for

  • quantities¶ – Key is name of parameter. Value is quantity containing value and unit for parameter.

Return type

None

getDerivativeVariables(time_evolution_types=None, return_type=<class 'sympy.core.symbol.Symbol'>)[source]

Get variables stored in model in same order as derivatives

__Recursion Base__

get symbolic variable associated with single derivative: names [str]

Parameters

  • self¶ – ~Function.Model to retrieve derivative variable(s) from

  • time_evolution_types¶ – only retrieve derivatives of this type(s), acts as a filter

  • return_type¶ – class type to return elements in list output as

getDerivativeVector(names=None, expanded=True, substitute_parameters=True, skip_parameters=None, substitute_equilibria=True, substitute_constants=True, substitute_functions=True, lambdified=False)[source]

Get derivative vector corresponding to derivatives in Model

Parameters

  • self¶ – ~Function.Model to retrieve derivative(s) from

  • names¶ – name(s) of variable(s) ordered in same order derivatives will be returned

  • expanded¶ – set True to get expanded expression for derivative, i.e. substitute all subexpressions into derivative expression. Set False to leave subexpressions as symbolic variables.

  • substitute_parameters¶ – set True to substitute numerical values in for all parameters. Set false otherwise

  • skip_parameters¶ – name(s) of parameter(s) to skip substitution for. Only called if substitute_parameters is set True.

  • substitute_equilibria¶ – set True to substitute equilibrium expressions in for variables in equilibrium. Set False to leave them as symbolic variables.

  • substitute_constants¶ – set True to substitute numerical values in for all constant derivative. Set False to leave them as symbolic variables.

  • substitute_functions¶ – set True to substitute corresponding functions in for all function-type derivatives. Set False to leave them as symbolic variables.

  • lambdified¶ – set True to return derivative vector as lambda function handle. Set False to return symbolic derivative vector

Returns

vector of derivatives. Uses derivatives in Model to determine derivatives. Returned as list of symbolic expressions if lambdified is set to True. Returned as lambda function handle if lambdified is set to False.

getDerivatives(time_evolution_types=None)[source]
__Purpose__

Get stored derivatives of given time-evolution type(s)

__Recursion Base__

get derivatives of single time-evolution type: time_evolution_types [str] get all derivatives: time_evolution_types [None]

Parameters

  • self¶ – ~Function.Model to retrieve derivative(s) from

  • time_evolution_types¶ – only retrieve derivatives of this type(s), acts as a filter

Return type

List[Derivative]

getDerivativesFromVariableNames(names)[source]

Get derivative corresponding to variable name.

Parameters

  • self¶ – Model to retrieve derivative(s) from

  • names¶ – name(s) of variable(s) associated with derivative(s)

Return type

Union[Derivative, List[Derivative]]

getEquilibriumFunction(name, substitute_parameters=True, skip_parameters=None, substitute_constants=True, substitute_functions=True)[source]
__Purpose__

Get equilibrium function corresponding to derivative

Parameters

  • self¶ – ~Function.Model to solve for equilibrium solution in

  • name¶ – name of variable to retrieve equilibrium expression of

  • substitute_parameters¶ – set True to substitute numerical values in for all parameters. Set false otherwise

  • skip_parameters¶ – name(s) of parameter(s) to skip substitution for. Only called if substitute_parameters is set True.

  • substitute_constants¶ – set True to substitute numerical values in for all constant derivative. Set False to leave them as symbolic variables.

  • substitute_functions¶ – set True to substitute corresponding functions in for all function-type derivatives. Set False to leave them as symbolic variables.

Return type

Expr

getEquilibriumSolutions(names=None, substitute_parameters=True, skip_parameters=None, substitute_constants=True, substitute_functions=True)[source]
__Purpose__

Get substitutions to substitute equilibrium variables into non-equilibrium derivatives

__Return__
dict:

key [sympy.Symbol] is variable to substitute into value [sympy.Expr] is expression to substitute into variable

Parameters

  • self¶ – ~Function.Model to solve for equilibrium solution(s) in

  • names¶ – name(s) of function(s) to solve for simulatenous equilibrium of

  • substitute_parameters¶ – set True to substitute numerical values in for all parameters. Set false otherwise

  • skip_parameters¶ – name(s) of parameter(s) to skip substitution for. Only called if substitute_parameters is set True.

  • substitute_constants¶ – set True to substitute numerical values in for all constant derivative. Set False to leave them as symbolic variables.

  • substitute_functions¶ – set True to substitute corresponding functions in for all function-type derivatives. Set False to leave them as symbolic variables.

Return type

Dict[Symbol, Expr]

getFunctionSubstitutions(names=None, substitute_parameters=True, skip_parameters=None, substitute_constants=True)[source]
Parameters

  • self¶ – ~Function.Model to retrieve functions from

  • names¶ – name(s) of variable(s) to retrieve function for

  • substitute_parameters¶ – set True to substitute numerical values in for all parameters. Set False to leave them as symbolic variables.

  • skip_parameters¶ – name(s) of parameter(s) to skip substitution for. Only called if substitute_parameters is set True.

  • substitute_constants¶ – set True to substitute numerical values in for all constant derivative. Set False to leave them as symbolic variables.

Return type

Dict[Symbol, Expr]

getFunctions(names=None, filter_type=None)[source]

__Recursion Base__

return single function if compatible with filter type: names [None]

Parameters

  • self¶ – Model to retrieve function(s) from

  • names¶ – name(s) of function(s) to retrieve

  • filter_type¶ – only retrieve function(s) of this class, acts as a filter

Return type

Union[Function, List[Function]]

getInitialValues(names=None, return_type=<class 'dict'>, initial_values=None)[source]

Get initial values for variables in model.

Parameters

  • self¶ – ~Function.Model to retrieve derivatives from

  • names¶ – name(s) of variables to retrieve values for

  • return_type¶ – class type for output. Must be dict, list, or ndarray. Only called if names is list.

  • initial_values¶ – dictionary of initial values if already known. Key is symbol for variable. Value is float for initial value.

Returns

Initial values for desired variables. Dictionary of initial values if return_type is dict; key is symbol for variable, value if float for initial value. List of floats if return_type is list. ndarray of float if return_type is ndarray.

class Function.Parent(children)[source]

Bases: object

__Purpose__

Properties for Function related to being a parent function to another function

__Attributes__

children [list of Function]: collection of children associated with function instance_arguments [list of dict list of sympy.Symbol]: arguments which parent function inputs into child function

first list index is index of stored child function dictionary key is argument species second list index is index of individual argument sent to child function

addChild(name, arguments)[source]

Add information to reference child function of parent.

Parameters

  • self¶ – Parent to add info into

  • name¶ – name of child to add into parent

  • arguments¶ – dictionary of information to reference child. Key is species of instance argument. Value is symbol(s) for this species of argument.

Return type

Dict[str, List[Symbol]]

Returns

Dictionary of information to reference child. Key is species of instance argument from parent. Value is symbol(s) for this species of argument.

addChildren(children)[source]

Add information to reference children functions of parent.

Parameters

  • self¶ – Parent to add info into

  • children¶ – dictionary of information to reference children. Key is name of child. Value is dictionary to pass into arguments

Return type

Dict[str, Dict[str, List[Symbol]]]

Returns

Dictionary of information to reference children. Key is name of child. Value is dictionary of information output from addChild()
